page.title: 03Recreation in Ashby .
page.content: The village pub is called the Old Coach House.It used to be an old farmhouse,with about 100 acres of land.In 1947 it became a pub and a farm, but now most of the land has been sold.The lounge is now where a pig sty used to be, and the old cow-shed has been converted to stables for horses. The pub has a pool table,skittles, and a dart-board.It is very popular with people from nearby villages and from Daventry.There is a large car-park and a beer-garden. There is no village institute, but there is a village hall where concerts,displays, and meetings are held.There is no youth club either, but the children occasionlly have discos in the village hall, or go to youth clubs in the larger villages nearby.
